text: I loved this game so much, it's definitely may favorite Tales game. I I thought the story was very endearing, but then again I'm a sucker for narratives about extreme heartfelt friendship :P

text: This is pleasant. My memories of Graces are very negative.
author: jb1980ist

text: The gameplay for Graces was the real highlight. If only the story was a better match
author: Waywarde

text:
All around, I really enjoyed this game.

The story was mediocre, and that's giving it more credit than it deserves, but the music was decent, the world was interesting enough, and I really loved the characters (except for Assbel, of course). The skits were amazing in the game, and really brought colour to the characters as well.

Also, this is the first game in the series to actually get me to love the combat. I tolerate it in other Tales games, but genuinely enjoyed it in Graces.
author: VentusxBBSxSpero

text: I haven't played a Tales games since Vesperia a couple years ago, so 2016 seems like a good year to play another one and Graces might be it! This is a very ambient theme with a nice, full sound, especially with headphones.
author: SupraDarky

text: +SupraDarky Graces is definitely a mixed bag, especially after Vesperia. The story is mediocre but I found that the character interactions were entertaining. I think Graces might have the best skits and combat all around.
author: Ryan O'Mullan

text: +Ryan O'Mullan which is why i loved it :)
author: KSib

text: @KSib It's a favorite of mine as well.
author: Ryan O'Mullan

text: +SupraDarky Definitely a mixed bag, but my opinions were the opposite of most others.  I liked the characters but I didn't like the battle system.  I didn't like the skits, but I liked the world it presented.  I think the game has more potential than for what was achieved.
author: terracannon876

text:
+SupraDarky I tell you what Supra, lots will tell you Graces is mediocre at best. Don't listen to them. While the story is, admittedly, a tad blander or generic compared to Symphonia or Vesperia, It's still fairly engaging. The Combat is bar none, the best in a tales game, and extremely fluid. 

Also a heads up, the description says this is Crush That Steel, just figured you should probably fix it. :)
author: Gouzaku Fuwachi

text: +SupraDarky  My favorite part of this game was leveling up all the titles you get.
author: Caleb C
